results.title: Playing Fair
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, Penny Ritco and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A series of four dramas for 7-12 year olds intended to promote discussion on the issues of racism, respect and equality for children. Each episode revolves around a conflict where a child is taunted and discriminated against because they are a member of a minority group. The situations are credible and expose the impact of such behaviour on children.

results.title: Playing fair
results.brief_description: Big Margie’s fair Play game show introduces young viewers to several positive behaviours important in play situations - sharing, helping, co-operating and taking turns. Students will learn to determine what is fair or unfair in a play situation, better perceive and evaluate their own behaviour, and explain how playing together and playing by the rules can be fun and rewarding. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Playing better tennis
results.creator_credit: Sports Films and Talents and Tate Lane
results.brief_description: America’s top professional tennis players combine playing and coaching skills to show beginners and intermediates the fundamentals of the serve, backhand, forehand, lob, volley and return of serve. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: Playing Beatie Bow
results.brief_description: The game is called Beatie Bow and the children play it for the thrill of scaring themselves. When Abigail is drawn in, the game is quickly transformed into an extraordinary adventure when she realises that somehow, through some eerie time shift, she had arrived in “The Rocks” of one hundred years ago. Stars Peter Phelps and Nikki Coghill. Based on the novel by Ruth Park.

results.title: Playgrounds for free
results.brief_description: Shows the construction of more than a dozen community built playgrounds throughout Pennsylvania under a special playground program. Shows how to use old tyres, oil drums, cable reels and other used materials. Tells how to assess resources, and puts the problem of vandalism in perspective.

results.title: Playground Discipline: A Positive Approach (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Playground disruption is a fact of life in the school world, but it can be successfully managed. This film demonstrates how to select and train older students to handle most of the conflicts that occur daily on the playground.
results.description: Playground disruption is a fact of life in the school world, but it can be successfully managed. This film demonstrates how to select and train older students to handle most of the conflicts that occur daily on the playground.

results.title: Playground (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles, David Grieve and Torben Strandgaard
results.brief_description: Employs live action, still photographs, animation and split frame techniques to show how creative playgrounds provide opportunities for children to build their own play environments and enjoy their creations in a non-regimented atmosphere.

results.title: Playground
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
The playground provides an opportunity for the child to develop his motor skills. Children are seen in this environment responding to the challenges of obstacles and play things.

results.title: Playful Pluto [silent] [edited version]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Joseph Schenck
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon starring Mickey Mouse and Pluto. A series of wacky slapstick comedy scenes as Pluto leads Mickey from one catastrophe to the next, all stemming from a fight with the hose in the backyard.
